meanings.definition: To supply or distribute something officially
meanings.sent1: The teacher issued textbooks to the students.
meanings.sent2: The government issued new guidelines for safety.
meanings.sent3: The librarian issued a decree that all overdue books must be returned by Friday.
meanings.sent4: The queen issued a royal proclamation to celebrate the holiday.
meanings.sent5: The company issued a statement clarifying their position on the matter.

meanings.definition: To make known or announce officially
meanings.sent1: The principal issued a statement regarding the upcoming school event.
meanings.sent2: The police issued a warning about the dangerous weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: The mayor issued a decree that all citizens must wear silly hats on Tuesdays.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity issued a public apology for their controversial remarks.
meanings.sent5: The company issued a press release to announce their new product launch.

meanings.definition: To come forth or emerge from a source
meanings.sent1: Smoke issued from the chimney of the old house.
meanings.sent2: Laughter issued from the children playing in the park.
meanings.sent3: Music issued from the mysterious box found in the attic.
meanings.sent4: A strong scent issued from the freshly baked cookies.
meanings.sent5: Light issued from the cracks in the wall, illuminating the room.
